item.title: uCode Adidas 2017
item.description: First hackathon held at the School of Engineering and Architecture of the University of Zaragoza, aimed at students at the national level offered by Adidas. uCode The challenges were offered by different companies and aimed at using artificial intelligence in different environments. We focused on the challenge offered by Adidas itself to identify shoes, in the way and with the purpose that each one wanted. Access was offered to the Institute of Biocomputation and Complex Systems Physics (BIFI), so that the Cloud infrastructure of the Aragon Supercomputing Center (CESAR) could be used.

item.title: Autonomous Mobile Robots
item.description: Autonomous Mobile Robots is the course of the University Jaume I (mooc) using Jupyter Notebooks and the simulator The Construct In this course i have learned to program the control of an autonomous robot with a simulator of the Pioneer P3 - DX mobile robot. Video presentation of the course in youtube

item.title: Nasa Hackathon
item.description: First great hackathon in which I participate with a pre-established team, in this case offered by NASA. We wanted to make our own project, so we made an android application that helped to identify the recyclable objects showing at the same time how much material and carbon emissions are saved in relation to the type of object to be recycled. At the same time it shows the container in which to recycle it, so that even small children can use the application, and compete with their friends to get better scores.

item.title: A telegram bot
item.description: As a user of the Zaragoza bus service, I've used several applications to get bus times, but fed up with the failures or malfunction, along with my desire to make bots for telegram, I decided to make my own bot to obtain the data of the buses using the Public API of Zaragoza. This is how I made my first bot. First the language and the basic objectives: Python 3.
